Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw two distinct habitats, one terrestrial and one aquatic, such as a forest and a pond.
The student can depict different types of living things in each habitat, including trees, grasses, and simple animals like lizards and fish.
The student can show some differences in plant diversity between the two habitats, like deciduous trees in the forest versus reeds in the pond.
The student can observe and represent patterns, such as more aquatic animals in the water habitat and more terrestrial animals in the land habitat.
CANNOT: The student may struggle to accurately show the full diversity of both habitats, possibly omitting less obvious organisms like insects or microorganisms (student may not have a complete understanding of ecosystem diversity).
The student might inconsistently label or identify the species correctly, such as labeling a squirrel as a rabbit (minor mislabeling of organisms).
